fields.description:
We have a long page that we cache using the {cache} macro, surrounding the entire page with the macro.

The caching works very well, but the rich text editor will not edit in rich text mode, but instead shows the content as wiki code.

If we add a character to the macro start, invalidating the macro like this {xcache}, flip to wiki mode and back to rich text, the rich text editor works as normal again.
fields.summary: Presence of {cache} in a page causes rich text editor to behave like wiki-mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14312].
  {panel}

The Notation Guide for Confluence 2.10.x (and for the installations of Confluence on CAC and EAC) is out of date.

*These modifications entail corrections and updates to parameter descriptions of the following macros:*
* *Activity Macros:*
** \{blog-posts}
** \{contentbylabel}
** \{recently-updated}
* \{loremipsum}
* \{recently-updated}

*MISTAKES (I.E. EXISTING CONTENT NEEDS CORRECTING):*
==============================================

The defaults indicated for the *max/maxResults* parameter of the above three *Activity Macro* descriptions are all wrong:

The default is *15* for each of these macros.

*UPDATES (I.E. NEW CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED):*
==========================================

*1) The _author_ parameter is missing from the above three macro descriptions.*
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please see the following pages for the appropriate descriptions:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Recently+Updated+Macro
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Blog+Posts+Macro
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Content+by+Label+Macro

*2) The _\{loremipsum}_ macro description is missing.*
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please see the following page for the appropriate description:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Loremipsum+macro
(May wish to add one of the examples provided on this page if space permits)

*3) The _\{recently-updated}_ macro is missing its _showProfilePic_ parameter/description.*
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This should be fairly similar to the one for the _\{recently-updated-dashboard}_ macro at:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Recently+Updated+Dashboard+Macro

Regards,
Giles.
fields.summary: The Confluence Notation Guide needs updating (to cover new features in 2.10.x and missing content).

fields.description:
h2. Update 1

The fix for CONF-12809 introduces a new 'location' where plugin authors can add further actions/options. This is the section at the bottom of the dashboard underneath the space list. It's default contents are the 'Add Space', 'Feed Builder' and 'People Directory' options.

So the documentation at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Web+UI+Plugins should have a new entry added to the locations table along the lines of -

| system.dashboard | (/) | (x) | The global dashboards action section - beneath the space list on the dashboard | 2.10.2 |

h2. Update 2
The [hiding the people directory documenation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Hiding+the+People+Directory] no longer requires the instructions on removing the links to the people directory from the dashboard and the browse menu. The fix for CONF-12809 makes these steps unnecessary.
fields.summary: Document new Web UI plugin location

fields.description:
Hi

In studio we use few  Confluence's components that are not exposed as available to plugins. 
Can you please have a look at our code and either make those components public (available to plugins) or suggest a better way to achieve desired functionality.

Currently we use ComponentLocator that goes directly to SpringContainer to get these components. 
List of places where we use ComponentLocator:

|| Where || Why ||
| [ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsSynchroniser|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/APL/trunk/applinks-confluence-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/applinks/confluence/trusted/ConfluenceTrustedApplicationsSynchroniser.java?r=26007] | Adding trusted application entry |
| [ConfluenceLicenseHandler|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/SAL/trunk/sal-confluence-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/sal/confluence/license/ConfluenceLicenseHandler.java?r=23973] | Setting a licence|
|[ConfluencePluginScheduler|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/SAL/trunk/sal-confluence-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/sal/confluence/scheduling/ConfluencePluginScheduler.java?r=23973]|Scheduling jobs|
|[ConfluenceCertificateFactory|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/SAL/trunk/sal-confluence-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/sal/confluence/trusted/ConfluenceCertificateFactory.java?r=17930]| Making trusted calls|
|[CrowdNotifyServlet|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/JST/trunk/studio-theme/studio-theme-confluence-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/studio/confluence/integration/crowd/CrowdNotifyServlet.java?r=26737]| Recalculating active user count when user is added/removed in crowd|
|[ConfluenceQuickNavProvider|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/browse/JST/trunk/studio-theme/studio-theme-confluence-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/studio/confluence/search/quicknav/ConfluenceQuickNavProvider.java?r=26469]| Doing QuickNav search in Studio|

Thanks
fields.summary: Studio plugins: Using components not available to plugins

fields.description: Inserting a link in Safari 3 of Firefox 3 puts the cursor at the start of the link that has been inserted rather than at the end of the link.  This is the case whether or not text was already selected when the insert link button was clicked.
fields.summary: Insert link in RTE leaves cursor at the start of the link instead of after it

fields.description:
"title" is a valid attribute for the input element, according to the DTD, but it seems to be being used instead of name="" which might work in browsers but isn't correct HTML. This makes JWebunit unable to find the input fields for asserting their contents. Apparently this is something to do with atlassian.js?

    <input type="hidden" title="editLabel" value="$action.getText('edit.name')">
    <input type="hidden" title="doneLabel" value="$action.getText('done.name')">
    <input type="hidden" title="showLocation" value="$action.locationShowing">
    <input type="hidden" title="hasChildren" value="$!helper.action.page.hasChildren()">
    <input type="hidden" title="availableSpacesSize" value="$action.availableSpaces.size()">
    <input type="hidden" title="spaceKey" value="$action.space.key">
    <input type="hidden" title="pageId" value="$pageId">
    <input type="hidden" title="actionMode" value="$mode">
    <input type="hidden" title="parentPageId" value="$!parentPage.id">
fields.summary: Weird form markup in page-location-form.vm

fields.description: When editing a page in IE 6, as soon as I put focus in the editor and hit return, the editor expands to the right and overwrites the help tips.  If I resize the browser the screen "fixes" itself, but as soon as I hit enter in the editor, the problem occurs again.  I provided two screen shots for before and after.  This does not occur in FF 3.
fields.summary: Tiny mce behavior in IE 6

fields.description:
We have a well established production Confluence installation which is using Atlassian User Management. We are testing migrating user authentication to Active Directory using LDAP but are keeping group management with in Confluence. In our test installation we have followed the instructions here http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Add+LDAP+Integration, including the "Stage 6 - Optional: Configure LDAP for User Authentication Only " of this page http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Customising+atlassian-user.xml to keep group management in Confluence.

We encountered the duplicate user bug http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-8098 but don't see this as a big issue as we can live with it. What is not so acceptable however is the fact that all users who exist in LDAP have lost their groups, so altho they can log in with their AD login, they cant do anything as they are no longer member of any groups. Do we have to go back and manually update our thousands of users and assign them to their right groups again? Is there any way to automate this? At a database level I tried:

•	insert into external_members (select userid, groupid from local_members)

but didn't seem to help

Is this a bug or 'feature'?

Thanks
John Parlane
fields.summary: after AD integration users lose their groups

fields.description:
Only occurs when the whole workbook has been encrypted, not where individual sheets are protected.

The problem actually lies with the Poi library, but the maintainers have closed the issue as "won't fix" because they won't touch anything involving encryption. They won't even detect the encryption and throw an informative exception, for fear of MS' lawyers, but note that users are welcome to write and maintain their own modules:
http://poi.apache.org/faq.html#faq-N10055

fields.description:
In IE 6 and Firefox 3 I get the follow javascript error when I open the edit/move page panel of one page.

Error: node is null
Source File: http://confluence.mycom.com/s/1322/3/1.0/_/download/resources/confluence.web.resources:page-ordering-tree/tree.js
Line: 89

I can move other pages, just not this one.

I got around the problem by creating another page with the same contents in the correct place. :(

fields.description:
When a PNG image with alpha channel transparency is added to a page as a thumbnail, the image loses its transparency. Instead an ugly wrong-colored box is drawn around the thumbnail, making thumbnails for PNGs essentially useless.

The original image when viewed by clicking on thumbnail, preserves the PNG transparency correctly.
fields.summary: Image thumbnail does not preserve PNG image transparency

A typical situation:
 - I add an image attachment
 - I now wish to edit the page to include a reference to the image.

Currently I have to click 'View', wait for a slow page rendering, then click 'Edit'.  Couldn't the 'Edit' link be added to the attachments page?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14280].
  {panel}

I need to be able to apply a label to the current set of page versions.  I would use this to set a baseline of the selected pages at a point in time.  This would require that the label only be applied to the current version of each page.  If a page were to change thereafter, the next version of that page would NOT have the label.

I want to use Confluence for requirements management, but without the ability to baseline requirements, I can't.  Labeling is a step in the right direction but I don't see any way to apply a label only to a specific version of a page.  This is really a different concept than your labels as implemented.  I'm drawing the distinction between "propagating labels" (what you have now) and "non-propagating labels" (specific to a version).

I need to set baselines so that QC tests against the same requirements that development worked from, and so development has a stable set of requirements during each sprint.  

Additional related features:  Ideally, team members could make comments that are specific to that (old) version of the page as well and I've have the option to promote each comment to the next version on a case by case basis.
fields.summary: Ability to apply a label only to current versions of pages to enable baselining
Autocomplete limited to 50 labels...

fields.description:
Confluence appends additional characters to the rendered output in the following circumstances:
  
# Create a new page in the RTE, with the body "some text"
# Make "some text" bold
# Change the colour "text"  of text
# Save

The output will be rendered as 
{noformat}
""some text*"*
{noformat}
fields.summary: Asterix and quote characters mangled with output when using bold, quote and text color in RTE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14262].
  {panel}

It would be extremely useful is it was possible to change the creator of an page (and other content) via the GUI.
As the creator is often considered as responsible for the content this might lead to misconceptions or unnecessary questions
for example in cases when the original creator might have left the company long time ago.

This is even more valid if pages were created by some innocent intern 
who might not have a single clue about the content he transfered into the system ;-D

I would envision functions for a individual change (as a right which can be granted to users) 
as well as batch transitions (change every bit of content from EmployeeA to EmployeeB as an administrative option) 

---

A slightly different approach might be to establish some sort of responsibility list for each item that can be edited,
although this would not prevent people from falling back to ask the creator forever and ever.
fields.summary: Deliberate change of Content Creator

fields.description:
(2) Confluence allows a user to add a child page under a page it cannot view (by choosing Add Page from the context menu while viewing the not accessible error message)

1. I have created a page with viewing restricted just to me.
2. I have tried access the page under a different account. I got the "You cannot view this page" message.
3. From the Add, menu, I have selected Page.
4. I got to the new page editor - I create a new page as a child of the restricted page I am not allowed to view.
5. After I save the page, instead of seeing the page contents, I get the message " You cannot view this page due to inherited restrictions "

For this issue, it's questionable whether it's a bug or a feature.

It can be perfectly explained - the new page was created as a child of a restricted page, and after it was saved, the inherited restrictions kicked in.

But if a user gets into this situation accidentally - the user just chooses "Add Page" to create a new page, without realizing he's currently trying to view an inaccessible page, the user could feel tricked that the content just posted is not accessible.

I personally think it's a bug and users should not be allowed to create child pages under pages they are not allowed to access.....
fields.summary: Disallow adding a child page under a page it cannot view in default theme

fields.description:
(1) After deleting a restricted page, the children still retain the inherited restrictions - until a first edit.

1. I have created a Restricted page (viewing restricted just to me), and a Child page of this page.
2. The Child page has correctly inherited the viewing restrictions.
3. I have Removed the Restricted page.
4. The Child page was still retaining the restrictions. The page info was still listing the restriction as inherited from the parent - even though it wasn't listing any parent and the page was an orphan page. When trying to view the page under a different account, I got a Not permitted due to inherited restrictions error.
5. I have edited the Child page - just opening in the editor and saving. The bogus inherited restrictions went away.

I believe this is a bug. After removing the parent restricted page (step 3), the inherited restrictions on the child page should have gone away immediately, and not only after editing the page.
fields.summary: After deleting a restricted page, the children still retain the inherited restrictions - until a first edit.

fields.description:
To reproduce create the following page with some image.

The Wiki markup is:

Some text before
!image.jpg!
Some text after

In Confluence 2.9 you could switch between Wiki markup and Rich text without breaking something. 
Since 2.10.1 however there is a regression! 

First time you switch to Rich text everything appears fine, but if you go back to Wiki markup it is:

Some text before
!image.jpg!Some text after

Switching back to Rich text and the image disappeared and the rich text itself is:

Some text before
!image.jpg!Some text after

Next time you switch to Wiki markup it is escaped to:

Some text before
\!image.jpg\!Some text after

etc.

Current workaround for Confluence 2.10.1 is to add a line break after the image, e.g.

Some text before
!image.jpg!

Some text after

works without round-trip problems in Confluence 2.10.1. In 2.9. this wasn't necessary.
fields.summary: Rich text WYSIWYG / Wiki markup round-trip regression (2.9 to 2.10.1) with inserted image

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14249].
{panel}
Confluence does not currently meet the [Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WAI-WCAG)|http://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20/]. In order for a growing number of governments to make use of Confluence, it would need to meet at least priority A and preferably priority AA of the standards.

The list of countries in which this is a requirement is growing and includes:
 # The Australian government
 # The Canadian government
 # The German government
 # The United States government (section 508)

Additionally, the space tools menu in the bottom left of the page can be opened and closed with a keyboard but there is no keyboard functionality for the items in the space tools menu. Pressing the up or down keyboard arrows or the enter key will open the menu but the focus is then not put on the menu and pressing tab will move you to the next page element instead of accessing the items in the menu.

Also when accessing dialogs like the "Keyboard Shortcuts", Other Macros or While modifying a macro's content in the main section, the right side of the dialog box is not able to be navigated via the keyboard. Pressing the up or down arrow or the enter key will change the focus of the items in the filter navigation but the focus is then not put on the main content that is being updated even with subsequent tabs or arrows presses.

*Both of these are accessibility issues that cannot be resolved through Javascript and CSS and are very disruptive.*
fields.summary: Improve accessibility by satisfying WAI-WCAG

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

In a conversation thread I leave a comment and do not have a watch set on the page.  At some latter time when I am not watching the wiki someone responds to  my comment and this cycles off the recent activity page.  Then I miss response and action to be taken for the page is delayed.

My solution would be that any response to one of my comments would send be an email of the conversation thread that my comment is in.

This could easily be a configurable option on a per user bases.

Also it would allow me to better keep track of the conversations that I am having on the wiki without being alerted to the page changing every time someone make a spelling change and it is not marked minor.

fields.description:
The Confluence installation and upgrade documentation do not explicitly say what the correct collation should be for a confluence database in MySQL, and there is conflicting information on subsequently linked pages.

This page, the one which tells you how to create an new database for Confluence with a MySQL GUI, does not specify what database engine, character encoding, or collation one should use when creating a MySQL database.
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+mySQL

This page, which is specifically about known issues in MySQL, mentions that if you're having errors on import from Hibernate, then you should use utf8_bin (which is a binary string comparison and therefore case sensitive)
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Known+Issues+for+MySQL

This page, which is about character encodings in MySQL, shows one how to create an empty Confluence database using the mysql command line client and uses the utf8_general_ci encoding (which is a case insensitive comparison).
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Database+Character+Encoding

This page, from an external source, helped me quickly understand the difference between utf8_general_ci and utf8_bin
http://www.phpbuilder.com/board/archive/index.php/t-10344217.html

I assume using utf8_bin is correct, but it would help greatly if you could clarify what is correct and update the documentation accordingly. Thanks!
fields.summary: Correct MySQL collation for Confluence database.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14211].
  {panel}

Background
----------------

Currently, the Quick Nav tool only indexes (and consequently find matches on) the titles of topics.

However, when people contribute content to a wiki space, they may only wish to segregate discrete chunks of information into sections containing anchored headings within an existing topic. The reasons for doing this are that such chunks of information may be (inter-)related and form part of a more general concept, or they are not deemed important enough for their own topics. For example, see [Searching Confluence|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Searching+Confluence], in which each type of search is presented in its own discrete section (with heading), within the general concept of 'Searching Confluence'.

Hence, it would be great if such headings could be incorporated into the Quick Nav functionality of Confluence.

How should this be done?
------------------------------------

Rather than making Confluence index every heading, I would suggest that only headings which have associated anchors are indexed for the Quick Nav feature. Reasons:
* Confluence needs something tangible (i.e. an anchor) it can use to jump to a specific section of information on a page
* If the author has not included an anchor with a heading, one could assume that they don't deem the associated information is worth searching (at that point). An anchor could always be added at a later time if the associated information is subsequently deemed useful.
* It would probably make it easier to develop - essentially, the Quick Nav indexer would parse a page, look for an \{anchor}, then look for a "hX." (where 'X' is a number) immediately after the anchor and then incorporate the text that follows this "hX." into the Quick Nav index.

How should the Quick Nav tool present these anchored headings?
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

See the attached image for an idea - it relates directly to the example I mentioned above. For example, on the Confluence 2.10 Doc space on CAC, search for "Quick Nav" and it should show something along the lines of what's presented in this image. (Refer to the actual page also!)
fields.summary: Incorporate the ability to identify 'anchored headings' within a topic into Quick Nav.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14208].
  {panel}

Quick nav is an awesome feature, but I think (and many of our users agree) that it would be even better if it was possible to take the current space into account when creating the quick nav result list.

There are two enhancements that could be done:

1) *Offer a shortcut to do a regular search with the entered keyword but only in the scope of the current space*
Quck nav always displays "Search for '<keyword>'" as the last item of the drop down menu. It would be great, it it also contained "Search for 'keyword' in <space key> wiki"

2) *Display results from the current space in a separate result section*
The results are now displayed in multiple sections (e.g. wiki pages, users, spaces, etc), it would be great if a new section was created containing only results from the current space. This section should be displayed as the first section.

These two features should be enabled only when a quick nav search is being done from a location in a wiki space and should be disabled when the location is the dashboard or other location outside of a wiki space

An extra suggestions: for the results from other spaces than the current one it would be nice to also see which space do these results come from.
fields.summary: Quick Nav should offer a space specific search options and results

fields.description:
In 3.0 Confluence will include an option to limit the number of items an RSS feed can request.

This setting can be found in 'Edit General Configuration' (see the attached screenshot) and defaults to 200.

The help text on General configuration says the following -
*Maximum RSS Items:*
Limit the maximum number of items an RSS Feed can request. If a feed requests more items than this setting then its requested number will be ignored and it will be limited to this value. 
*Default: 200*

This setting is only available to a Confluence System Administrator.

When using the Feed Builder if you enter a value greater than this setting (or less than 0) you will get a validation error as shown in another screenshot attached.

Any feeds (e.g. existing feeds) which request more than the configured maximum will be supplied only with the configured maximum number of items. This is done silently - there is no logging and no message returned to the RSS reader.
fields.summary: Document added General Configuration option to limit the maximum number of RSS items in a feed

fields.description:
According to your documentation, you need to {noformat}Use two backslashes (\\) to create a line break.{noformat}

Further:

{noformat}An empty line produces a new paragraph.
Most of the time, explicit paragraph breaks are not required -
Confluence will be able to paginate your paragraphs properly.{noformat}

Alas, per the discussion here, this is not the case:  http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Working+with+Text+Breaks?focusedCommentId=194755#comment-194755

A linefeed at the end of a line
Without an empty line

Results in rendered text that includes the linefeed.  Expected behavior is that the two lines are concatenated into a paragraph that properly word-wraps.  You already have a documented method for forcing linebreaks within a paragraph, so why do you have an undocumented method that screws up people who might be working in 80-column mode and then pasting their text into Confluence?
fields.summary: Linefeeds at the end of lines in WikiMarkup should *not* create new linebreaks on rendered page

This affects both Internet Explorer and Firefox, contrary to other Bug reports

When updating the label box at the bottom of the editor (in any editing mode), after typing in the beginning of a label, a drop down box appears of 'suggested' labels.  When you mouse-over a suggested label, the window scrolls such that the label your mouse is over is at the bottom of the window.

fields.description:
The standard PDF export options of Confluence provide bad results when having tables or, in certain cases, images. 

If I use any other (free) PDF printer and go to print options in my browser, the result is much better. See the attachments for the differences.

Summarizing;
* tables are messed up; colums are divided evenly, regardless of the content and sizing on the page itself
* pictures; if included from external resources (other spaces/pages) can show the error notification "Cannot resolve external resource into attachment"

Overall, this makes the PDF-functionalities of Confluence limited. It is useful, but people cannot rely on it.

Example page on EAC: [Noformat square brackets in title escape test|http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~pdzwart/Noformat+square+brackets+in+title+escape+test] Example page on CAC: [Noformat square brackets in title escape test|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~pdzwart/Noformat+square+brackets+in+title+escape+test] This report uses the same Confluence page for demonstration as per [CONF-14185].
fields.summary: "View wiki markup" does not preserve whitespace

fields.description:
Generally, when using the Confluence Wiki Markup, square brackets \[ & \] can be escaped using a back-slash \. However, when attempting to use the same behaviour within the title attribute of the \{noformat\} macro, this does not happen; and a {color:red}+new page+{color} link appears.

Example page on EAC: [Noformat square brackets in title escape test|http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~pdzwart/Noformat+square+brackets+in+title+escape+test]
Example page on CAC: [Noformat square brackets in title escape test|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~pdzwart/Noformat+square+brackets+in+title+escape+test]

!http://img.skitch.com/20090113-fqex31e3trwcnfdepm3kubyabn.png!
fields.summary: Square Brackets in the Title of a {noformat} macro can not be escaped, causes a new page link to appear

fields.description:
As part of the Rest work Sam and I are doing we need to have the servlet module manager exposed for other plugins to access.

We need to change the definition of the servlet module manager to be the following:

{code:xml}
<bean id="servletModuleManager" class="com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.DefaultServletModuleManager" plugin:available="true">
    <constructor-arg index="0" ref="pluginEventManager"/>
</bean>
{code}
fields.summary: Please add plugin:available="true" to the servletModuleManager
Pasting into Table Cells in the RTE causes problems
Code macro doesn't highlight "order" in SQL

fields.description: Performance testing showed that up to 11% of total execution time is spent ognl.OgnlRuntime class. Threads are blocked on synchronized access to class cache. We can improve the synchronization here by using better data structures for cache (ConcurrentHashMap instead of synchronizing each time we access cache).
fields.summary: Reduce blocking inside ognl.OgnlRuntime
Add support for Bandana globbing/wildcards
viewfile macros cannot render PDF file which is secured by password

fields.description:
When attempting to move a page out of my personal space, the pagetree of the space to move to is displayed but the page to move doesn't appear. There is a weird grey radial thing occluding one of the entries instead:

!http://img.skitch.com/20090112-qucccwg4521e397k9mfkqntwkd.png!

Essentially the highlighted page disappears. You can complete the move action, and the page appears in the root of the target space:

!http://img.skitch.com/20090112-j8s6s1ndrtkkcw3h8qn7jhkyph.png!
fields.summary: Unable to accurately move a page from personal space to another space

fields.description:
Given the following wiki source:

{noformat}
Testing -- en
Testing-- en
Testing --en
Testing--en
{noformat}

You get the following output:

{panel}
Testing -- en
Testing-- en
Testing --en
Testing--en
{panel}

Only the first one is rendered correctly because the en-dash is not rendered if it occurs next to a word. This hinders using en-dashes where you normally would, like in a range (e.g. 1-5pm).

The same problem happens with em-dashes, using three hyphens in the markup.
fields.summary: Em- and en-dashes can't occur right next to a word

fields.description:
Implement Macro Browser specification for the RTE and Wiki Markup editor. 

The macro browser should enable users to browse through all the enabled macros in the system. It should also assist users to insert macros by displaying the macro's list of parameters with appropriate descriptions and input form fields.
fields.summary: Confluence Macro Browser
